column4: hi all.. i am having trouble getting Java working in firefox.. can someone please help
install sun-java6-plugin
what i am to expect with your command..
if you have version 5 use sun-java5-plugin
is a package not a command sudo apt-get install sun-java5-plugin  that will install the firefox (mozilla) java plugin
i just searched for the plugin package in synaptic.. but don't find anything..
is there in multiverse
go to system>admin>software sources and make sure you have multiverse enabled
yes i have multivers enables in s/w sources ..
then just «sudo apt-get install sun-java5-plugin»
i just tried that and got apt-get error that the package is missing or obsolete .. would this be because i am on AMD64 laptop??
oops yes no firefox plugin for the 64 bits version
i use 64 bits myself
i have also installed Swiftweasel
have you tried SwiftWeasel browser.. i was able to get 32bit flash working on it.. i didn't realize i had trouble with java
no; the package flashplugin-nonfree configured flash for firefox64 bits without problems (that was before it broke)
and i do not use java applets
.. thx for your help..
.. will try & figure this out..
no problem
is a tar archive compressed with gzip. It is like a rar or zip file
